results.title: Jumpcut
results.brief_description: Two pieces of found footage were used to produce ‘Jumpcut’, a series of frames cut from the head and tails of various takes of a talking head shot for a 1970s industrial film or commercial; and a piece of 1950s/60s home movie footage depicting a jumping child interrupted by the perforation marks at the end of the reel. Both images are processed through the Cox Box. The loop of the jumping boy had developed, over time, a network of miniscule cracks in the emulsion which were further emphasised by the increased contrast of the processing and the slow motion.

results.title: The Guan Yin Temple
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Dean Lawry and Kim Montgomery
results.brief_description: In this interview, Ralph Beh - a curator at the Golden Dragon Museum in Bendigo dicusses the history and significance of the remarkable murals that adorn the inner walls of the Guan Yin temple on the museum’s grounds.

results.title: MEART
results.brief_description: Located at the School of Anatomy and Human Biology, University of Western Australia. The SymbioticA Research Group (Sarg) has collaborated with the Laboratory for Neuroengineering at Georgia Tech in the US for the last 3 years. The collective is: Oran Catts, Research Director; Ionat Zurr, New Media; Guy Ben-Ary, Biological Artist; Phil Gamblin, Artist; Dr Stuart Bunt, Founder & Scientific Director.

results.title: Growing up in Bendigo
results.brief_description: Bendigo - short MTV style doco compiled from short interviews with teenagers on the streets of Bendigo. Subject matter includes how they feel about living in Bendigo, their hopes, aspirations, and whether they would like to stay in the town they grew up in as adults

results.title: Diary of a male whore
results.brief_description: Wael’s powerful, uncompromising short turns the body of its protagonist into a war zone, playing out the ongoing Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Loosely based on Moroccan author Mohamed Choukri’s For bread alone, a young Palestinian prostitute recalls his at times violent sexual awakening. As this all takes place during an encounter with an Israeli male client, Diary of a male whore also highlights the fraught state of the Israeli-Palestinian ‘peace’ process.

results.title: The Irrepressible Jack Stone
results.brief_description: A heartbreaking but inspiring story about Jack Stone, the kid who lived every moment of his life to the fullest - as told by his mother. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) in partnership with VicHealth. You can create your won Digital Story. Ask at the Information Desk or go to www.acmi.net.au/digitalstorytelling

results.title: The Pub
results.brief_description:
Annabel spent the first 7 years of her life living above her parent’s pub. She reminisces about all the adventures had by her and her siblings as they run amok in their unconventional playground.
You can create your own Digital Story. Ask at the Information Desk or visit www.acmi.net.au/digitalstorytelling

results.title: The Golden dragons
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Dean Lawry and Kim Montgomery
results.brief_description: Bendigo - Bendigo’s annual Easter parade has featured the Dragon and Lion dancers from the Bendigo Chinese Association for over 100 years. This mini documentary explores how this historical tradition has helped shape the identities of the dancers and features interviews combined with footage of their colourful and exciting dance held at dusk at the Dragons’ spiritual home - Bendigo’s Golden Dragon Museum of Australia

results.title: Friends of the Bendigo Botanical Gardens
results.brief_description: Bendigo is better known for its old historic buildings than its heritage listed Botanic Gardens. Jan Orr, Rodney Orr and Glenys Anthony, members of the Friends of the Bendigo Botanic Gardens, talk about the history and some of the features of the Conservatory Gardens, including the rose garden and the fernery. The aim of the “Friends” group is to promote, protect and restore Bendigo’s heritage listed gardens.

results.title: Heart disease
results.brief_description: Neil created this story as a document of how surviving a heart attack completely changed his life. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story / Telling Stories, Building Communities’ Digital Storytelling Project ACMI in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) and supported by Vic Health.
